oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Risk-Sensitive Ergodic Control of Continuous Time Markov Processes With Denumerable State Space
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, KS
PAL, C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SPECTRAL THEORY
MONOTONE COST
Risk-sensitive control
Controlled Markov chain
Multiplicative dynamic programming principle
Twisted kernel
Geometric ergodicity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this article, we study risk-sensitive control problem with controlled continuous time Markov chain state dynamics. Using multiplicative dynamic programming principle along with the atomic structure of the state dynamics, we prove the existence and a characterization of optimal risk-sensitive control under geometric ergodicity of the state dynamics along with a smallness condition on the running cost.
